result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on February 6, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Leander Jones III in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Leander Jones III.  Attorney Ben Wagner for  Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Set case 20CF2159 for trial, case 22CF1667 to follow as status.
and returned.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $1,000 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant is not to have any contact face to face with Chanel J. Defendant may have contact with Chanel J by phone or other electronic communication only.  
- Defendant shall not be at the residence of Chanel J.

10:27 AM Defendant Leander Jones III in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Leander Jones III.  Attorney Ben Wagner for  Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights compliant.
Re: request by bond poster to return cash bail. Bond poster appeared in person, statement made. State objects to modification to signature bond. Objection stated by Defense. 
Court makes ruling and amends case to signature bond $1000. All other conditions previously ordered to remain. Cash posted to be returned to bond poster.
Bail/bond hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant is not to have any contact face to face with Chanel J. Defendant may have contact with Chanel J by phone or other electronic communication only.

Defendant Leander Jones III in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Leander Jones III.  Attorney Trisha Simmons for  Daniel R. Hess in court for State of Wisconsin.

IN CUSTODY
Re: Defense motion for bail reduction
 Argument in support of motion by Atty Benavides. Response by Trisha Simmons. 
Court makes ruling and amends bail to $5000 cash, Court deletes condition of No contact with Chanel J.
Added condition is  No contact with Chanel J except  by phone or other electronic communication only with Chanel J, no contact face to face.  All other conditions remain the same.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Prosecuting attorney Will R Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides in court for Leander Jones III.  State calls MPD Officer K. Schaefer, sworn.  Direct. Officer identifies defendant. Cross. Witness excused.  State moves for bind over, waives arguments, saves for rebuttal.  Atty. Benavides objects, and argues.  State's rebuttal. CT: finds probable cause and does bind over.

ADDRESS INFO for Leander Jones III
Current: c/o DCJ,   (Effective: 07-13-2022)

Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:53 PM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes request for set over due to witness not being available;  State non-compliance as to Marsy's law.  Atty Benavides objects and request for a ruling by the court. Court denies request. Court adrdresses Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Cash Bail. Court does not modify bail and request modifications be done before trial branch. All conditions of bond shall remain the same. Court finds good cause for set over and waives time limits. Court requests State be in compliance for next upcoming scheduled hrg date. No objection by counsel.
Defense
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Chanel J. 
- Defendant shall not be at the residence of Chanel J. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

03:24 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
